ci_support_linux_64_r_base4.4.yaml:
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cran_mirror:
- https://cran.r-project.org
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  r-base:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
r_base:
- '4.4'
target_platform:
- linux-64

about.summary: There are two functions-meta2d and meta3d for detecting rhythmic signals from time-series datasets. For analyzing time-series datasets without individual information, 'meta2d' is  suggested, which could incorporates multiple methods from ARSER,  JTK_CYCLE and Lomb-Scargle in the detection of interested rhythms. For  analyzing time-series datasets with individual information, 'meta3d' is  suggested, which takes use of any one of these three methods to analyze  time-series data individual by individual and gives out integrated values  based on analysis result of each individual.

There are two functions-meta2d and meta3d for detecting rhythmic signals from time-series datasets. For analyzing time-series datasets without individual information, 'meta2d' is  suggested, which could incorporates multiple methods from ARSER,  JTK_CYCLE and Lomb-Scargle in the detection of interested rhythms. For  analyzing time-series datasets with individual information, 'meta3d' is  suggested, which takes use of any one of these three methods to analyze  time-series data individual by individual and gives out integrated values  based on analysis result of each individual.

name: r-metacycle
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "1.2.1" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-metacycle
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/MetaCycle_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/MetaCycle/MetaCycle_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: c50aaedf83bb6adf98844b13598a52d7356c66cc43624f96a4ed5d9169076903

build:
  number: 0
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-gnm
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-gnm

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('MetaCycle')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('MetaCycle')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=MetaCycle
  license: GPL-2.0-or-later
  summary: There are two functions-meta2d and meta3d for detecting rhythmic signals from time-series datasets. For analyzing time-series datasets without individual information, 'meta2d' is  suggested, which could incorporates multiple methods from ARSER,  JTK_CYCLE and Lomb-Scargle in the detection of interested 
    rhythms. For  analyzing time-series datasets with individual information, 'meta3d' is  suggested, which takes use of any one of these three methods to analyze  time-series data individual by individual and gives out integrated values  based on analysis result of each individual.
  license_family: GPL3
  license_file: '{{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/GPL-2'

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r

# Package: MetaCycle
# Type: Package
# Title: Evaluate Periodicity in Large Scale Data
# Version: 1.2.0
# Authors@R: c( person("Gang", "Wu",, email = "wggucas@gmail.com", role = c("aut", "cre")), person("Ron", "Anafi",, email = "ranafi@gmail.com", role = c("aut", "ctb")), person("John", "Hogenesch",, email = "hogenesch@gmail.com", role = c("aut", "ctb")), person("Michael", "Hughes",, email = "michael.evan.hughes@gmail.com", role = c("aut", "ctb")), person("Karl", "Kornacker",, email = "kornacker@midohio.twcbc.com", role = c("aut", "ctb")), person("Xavier", "Li",, email = "haohan.li.97@gmail.com", role = c("aut", "ctb")), person("Matthew", "Carlucci",, email = "matt.carlucci.96@gmail.com", role = c("aut", "ctb")) )
# Description: There are two functions-meta2d and meta3d for detecting rhythmic signals from time-series datasets. For analyzing time-series datasets without individual information, 'meta2d' is  suggested, which could incorporates multiple methods from ARSER,  JTK_CYCLE and Lomb-Scargle in the detection of interested rhythms. For  analyzing time-series datasets with individual information, 'meta3d' is  suggested, which takes use of any one of these three methods to analyze  time-series data individual by individual and gives out integrated values  based on analysis result of each individual.
# Depends: R (>= 3.0.2)
# Imports: gnm
# Suggests: knitr, rmarkdown, parallel
# VignetteBuilder: knitr
# License: GPL (>= 2)
# LazyData: true
# Author: Gang Wu [aut, cre], Ron Anafi [aut, ctb], John Hogenesch [aut, ctb], Michael Hughes [aut, ctb], Karl Kornacker [aut, ctb], Xavier Li [aut, ctb], Matthew Carlucci [aut, ctb]
# Maintainer: Gang Wu <wggucas@gmail.com>
# NeedsCompilation: no
